scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
plunges, al, con, throt, sikhs, hor, bly, er, fuck, jammed, knelt, sent, slalom, ger, ri, aiken, tite, pe, twat

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — An undesirable person.
B. (1 syllables) — rest one's weight on one's knees
C. (2 syllables) — To agree in opinion or sentiment; to be of the same mind; to accord; to concur.
D. (1 syllables) — The sport of skiing in a zigzag course through gates.
E. (2 syllables) — United States author of inspirational adventure stories for boys; virtue and hard work overcome poverty (1832-1899)
F. (1 syllables) — an adherent of Sikhism
G. (3 syllables) — With a very bad effect.
H. (2 syllables) — A mutant first discovered in the yeast , forming small colonies when grown in the presence of fermentable carbon sources such as glucose.
I. (1 syllables) — cause to be immersed

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
